name: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
description: A young boy discovers he is a wizard and attends a magical school, where he uncovers a dark secret.

name: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian regime where the government watches everyone and controls thought.

name: J.R.R. Tolkien
title: The Hobbit
description: A hobbit embarks on an unexpected journey to reclaim a lost kingdom from a fearsome dragon.

name: F. Scott Fitzgerald
title: The Great Gatsby
description: A mysterious millionaire throws lavish parties in pursuit of an unrequited love during the Jazz Age.

name: Harper Lee
title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A young girl navigates the challenges of race and justice in the American South during the 1930s.

name: Herman Melville
title: Moby-Dick
description: The quest of Captain Ahab to hunt down the elusive white whale, Moby-Dick, aboard the whaling ship Pequod.

name: Jane Austen
title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A story about the complexities of love, class, and misunderstandings as Elizabeth Bennet navigates life and relationships.

name: Mary Shelley
title: Frankenstein
description: A scientist creates a sentient creature in an unorthodox experiment, leading to tragic consequences.

name: Leo Tolstoy
title: War and Peace
description: A vast narrative exploring Russian society during the Napoleonic Wars, focusing on five families.

name: Emily BrontÃ«
title: Wuthering Heights
description: A dark and passionate tale of the intense love between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff, set on the Yorkshire moors.
